intro: Nothites angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf nothite, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, often grouped into dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Nothites angustifolia is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
